adjective.description: Of or belonging to Parmenides; relating to or characteristic of his philosophy that everything in existence is but a manifestation of a single eternal reality.

noun.description: A follower or supporter of Parmenides, or an adherent of his philosophy. rare.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in Ralph Cudworth (1617–1688), philosopher and theologian. From the name of Parmenides (ancient Greek Παρμενίδης, classical Latin Parmenidēs) of Elea in Southern Italy, a Greek philosopher of the 5th cent. b.c. + -an.
